org.grouplens.lenskit.scored

Class ScoredIdListBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.grouplens.lenskit.scored.ScoredIdListBuilder
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.apache.commons.lang3.builder.Builder<PackedScoredIdList>
    Deprecated. 
    Scored IDs are going away in LensKit 3.0.

    @Deprecated
public class ScoredIdListBuilder
extends Object
implements org.apache.commons.lang3.builder.Builder<PackedScoredIdList>

    Builder for packed lists of scored ids. All ids in the resulting list will have the same set of side channels.

    Since:
    1.4
    Compatibility
    Public

    • Method Detail

      • build

        public PackedScoredIdList build()
        Deprecated. 
        Specified by:
        build in interface org.apache.commons.lang3.builder.Builder<PackedScoredIdList>

      • finish

        public PackedScoredIdList finish()
        Deprecated. 

        Destructive version of build(), re-using storage if possible. Future use of the builder is impossible, and all memory used by it is released.

        Returns:
        The scored ID list.

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Deprecated. 

        Clear the builder. After it is cleared, it can no longer be used.

      • buildVector

        public ImmutableSparseVector buildVector()
        Deprecated. 

        Build a sparse vector directly from the list of IDs. This allows a scored ID list builder to be used to efficiently accumulate a sparse vector. If the same ID is added multiple times, the first instance is used.

        Returns:
        A sparse vector containing the data accumulated.

      • size

        public int size()
        Deprecated. 

        Get the number of items currently in the builder.

        Returns:
        The number of items in the builder.

      • add

        public ScoredIdListBuilder add(long id,
                               double score)
        Deprecated. 

        Add a scored ID without boxing. The default value will be used for each channel.

        Parameters:
        id - The ID to add.
        score - The score for the ID.
        Returns:
        The builder (for chaining).

      • add

        public ScoredIdListBuilder add(ScoredId id)
        Deprecated. 

        Add a scored ID. The ID is copied into the builder, not referenced. All side channels on the ID must have already been added with one of the addChannel methods.

        Parameters:
        id - The ID.
        Returns:
        The builder (for chaining).

      • addAll

        public ScoredIdListBuilder addAll(Iterable<ScoredId> ids)
        Deprecated. 

        Add a collection of IDs. The IDs are copied into the builder, not referenced.

        Parameters:
        ids - The IDs to add.
        Returns:
        The builder (for chaining)

      • addChannel

        public ScoredIdListBuilder addChannel(Symbol sym)
        Deprecated. 

        Add a side channel to the list builder with a default value of 0. It is an error to add the same symbol multiple times. All side channels that will be used must be added prior to calling add(ScoredId).

        Parameters:
        sym - The symbol to add.
        Returns:
        The builder (for chaining).
        See Also:
        addChannel(Symbol, double)

      • addChannel

        public ScoredIdListBuilder addChannel(Symbol sym,
                                      double dft)
        Deprecated. 

        Add a side channel to the list builder. It is an error to add the same symbol multiple times. All side channels that will be used must be added prior to calling add(ScoredId).

        Parameters:
        sym - The symbol to add.
        dft - The default value when adding IDs that lack this channel.
        Returns:
        The builder (for chaining).

      • addChannels

        public ScoredIdListBuilder addChannels(Iterable<Symbol> channels)
        Deprecated. 

        Add multiple unboxed channels with a default value of 0.

        Parameters:
        channels - The channels to add.
        Returns:
        The builder (for chaining).

      • addChannel

        public ScoredIdListBuilder addChannel(TypedSymbol<?> sym)
        Deprecated. 

        Add a side channel to the list builder. It is an error to add the same symbol multiple times. All side channels that will be used must be added prior to calling add(ScoredId).

        Parameters:
        sym - The symbol to add.
        Returns:
        The builder (for chaining).
        See Also:
        addChannel(TypedSymbol, Object)

      • addChannel

        public <T> ScoredIdListBuilder addChannel(TypedSymbol<T> sym,
                                          T dft)
        Deprecated. 

        Add a typed side channel to the list builder. It is an error to add the same symbol multiple times. All side channels that will be used must be added prior to calling add(ScoredId).

        Parameters:
        sym - The symbol to add.
        dft - The default value when adding ids that lack this channel. If null, it will be omitted from such ids.
        Returns:
        The builder (for chaining).

      • addTypedChannels

        public ScoredIdListBuilder addTypedChannels(Iterable<? extends TypedSymbol<?>> channels)
        Deprecated. 

        Add multiple channels with a default value of null.

        Parameters:
        channels - The channels to add.
        Returns:
        The builder (for chaining).

      • ignoreUnknownChannels

        public ScoredIdListBuilder ignoreUnknownChannels()
        Deprecated. 

        Set the builder to ignore unknown channels on IDs passed to add(ScoredId).

        Returns:
        The builder (for chaining).

      • failOnUnknownChannels

        public ScoredIdListBuilder failOnUnknownChannels()
        Deprecated. 

        Set the builder to fail on unknown channels. This is the default response to unknown channels.

        Returns:
        The builder (for chaining).

      • sort

        public ScoredIdListBuilder sort(Comparator<ScoredId> order)
        Deprecated. 

        Sort the list-in-progress by the specified comparator.

        Parameters:
        order - The comparator.
        Returns:
        The buidler (for chaining).
